p: Furthermore, dynamical processes in the atmosphere—like large‐scale circulation (Jones, 1999; Xoplaki et al., 2003) and the sequence of low‐/high‐pressure systems (e.g., Rodrigues & Woollings, 2017; Sillmann & Croci‐Maspoli, 2009)—that lead to a geographical redistribution of energy impact near‐surface air temperatures. In several regions, about half of the near‐surface air temperature variability on monthly time scales can be explained by thermal advection (Holmes et al., 2016).
